Description: Stamp (vessel): mikyala. Measure of white cumin. Six line inscription. Fragment of hollow rim attached. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4076. From the same die: Miles, G.C. 1951. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps: a supplement’. New York, 23; Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 176; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 393-4. Cf. Launois 1957, 177-8; Balog 1976, 395.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (220)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
